title: Thunderbird data disappeared on Ubuntu upgrade
content: I upgraded my Ubuntu 22.04 OS to Ubuntu 24.04, all went well except for Thunderbird which was completely removed! When I try to install it my previous password is refused. I was able to reset it but none of my data (inbox messages, addresses etc ) are there. I also use an extended support version of Ubuntu 16.04 and have Thunderbird still working there perfectly. When I originally installed Ubuntu 22.04 I had no problem with password refusal or all my data not being imported from U16. Can you please advise, Derek
creator: brummanextra

title: inicio en segundo plano
content: Buenos días, recientemente he vuelto a Thunderbird, ha cambiado mucho desde que lo usaba habitualmente, para bien, pero veo que sigue sin tener una característica clave que tienen la mayoría de gestores de correo: Iniciarse en segundo plano silenciosamente y que al cerrar se mantenga en segundo plano un servicio para seguir recibiendo correos. Hay planes de desarrollo para incorporar esto, hay algún plugin que haga esto, ya conozco los de start minimized pero es muy tosco
creator: Fruit

content:

creator: dvdgiardini

title: The task reminder window does not appear
content:
Windows: Win11 24H2 Thunderbird: Version 139.0.1

The screenshot shows the reminder window. The window appeared, I enter sleep on the computer, come out of sleep, there is no window. The same thing happens if I close Thunderbird (with a cross in the upper right corner) and then launch it. And the same thing happens after the computer is turned off and on.

What actions have I done to understand the problem: 1) deleted the profile and created a new empty one, i.e. profile files have no effect on this; 2) reinstalled Thunderbird.

The problem started 3-4 days ago. The problem may have occurred after the Thunderbird program update - the update was on June 2.
creator: surikov.konst.email

title: Where do I enter my updated password ?
content:
I have updated my password on my IMAP server. I cannot find where to enter the new password on the server settings. There used to be a box for this. It asked once when I logged in but dosnt ask again.

This must be one of the most basic settings that needs occasional updating but no clear location where to do it?

Its now made thunderbird un useable and have migrated across to outlook where you just type in the new password.
creator: jim73

title: Thunderbird hangs attempting to load very large emails
content:
We receive very large text emails from logwatch on one of our servers. Thunderbird becomes unresponsive for several minutes. When it "comes back" other messages can be selected but no content is displayed, and everything is slow to respond. Clicking the X to close the app takes upwards of 30 seconds to actually close the app.

Is there some setting to increase heap / RAM? Or is this a different issue?
creator: osavill

title: Incoming emails
content: My emails are no longer showing in my inbox for last 2 days but they do show in All emails. How do I correct this?
creator: miconeill.mon
